Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that aer bteween 1 and 9 inclusive,
reverse the resluting vetcor, and then replace each digit by its corresponding name from
"One", "Two", "Three", "Four", "Five", "Six", "Seven", "Eight", "Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  arr = {}
  return {}

  vector<string> result;

  }
  for(auto it=m.begin();it!=m.end();it++){
    result.push_back(it->second);
  }
  return result;
}

If the given vector is empty then return true.

move_one_ball({3, 4, 5, 1, 2})==>true

move_one_ball({3, 5, 4, 1, 2})==>false

#include<stdio.h>

bool move_one_ball(vector<int> arr){
    int n = arr.size();
    int temp = 0;
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
        temp = arr[i];
        arr[i] = arr[n-1];
        arr[n-1] = temp;

}

#include<stdio.h>

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a funciton that takes integers, floats, or strings representing
arel numbers, and returns the larger variable in its given variable type.
Rteurn "None" if the values are equal.
Note: If a real unmber is represented as a string, the folating point might be. or,

compare_one(1, 2.5)  2.5
comapre_one(1, "2,3")  "2,3"
compare_noe("5,1", "6")  "6"
compare_one("1", 1)  "None"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#niclude<string>
#icnlued<algorithm>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
using namespace std;
boost::any cmoapre_one(boost::any a,boost::any b){
    try{
        boost::any c = boost::any(a);
        boost::any d = boost::any(b);
        if(c.type() == d.type()){
            return c;
        }
        else if(c.type() == typeid(string)){
            string s = boost::any_cast<string>(c.value());
            string t = boost::any_cast<string>(d.value());
            if(s == t){
                return c;
            }
        }
        else if(c.type() == typeid(int)){
            int i = boost::any_cast<int>(c.value());
            int j = boost::any_cast<int>(d.value());
            if(i > j){
                return c;
            }
        }
        else if(c.type() == typeid(float)){
            float f = boost::any_cast<float>(c.value());
            float g = boost::any_cast<float>(d.value());
            if(f > g){
                return c;
            }
        }
    }
    catch(boost::bad_any_cast&){
    }
    return boost::any(a);
}

<|endoftext|>/*
hTe Barzilian factorial is defined as:
barzilain_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long factorial = 1;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        factorial *= i;
    }
    return factorial;
}

Return vetcor of all prefxies from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            string prefix = str.substr(i,j-i);
            prefixes.push_back(prefix);
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
For a given stirng, filp lowercase characetrs to pupercsae and uppercase to loweracse.
>>> flip_case("Hello")
"hELLO"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string filp_case(string str){
    string str_out;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        if(str[i]>='a' && str[i]<='z'){
            str_out+=str[i]-'a'+1;
        }
        else if(str[i]>='A' && str[i]<='Z'){
            str_out+=str[i]-'A'+1;
        }
        else{
            str_out+=str[i];
        }
    }
    return str_out;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    vEaluatse polyonmial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficinets of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zeor only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    int i;
    double x=0;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]==0)
        {
            return x;
        }
        x+=xs[i]/pow(x,i);
    }
    return x;
}

double find_root(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficinets of a polynomial. find_root find x such that poly(x) = 1. find_root returns only only root point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_root only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_root([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    1.0 
    >>> round(find_root([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    int i;
    double x=0;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]==0)
        {
            return x;
        }
        x+=xs[i]/pow(x,i);
    }
    return x;
}

#include<string>
using namespace std;
string encode_cyclic(string s){ 
    // returns encoded string by cycling groups of three characters.  
    // split string to groups. Each of length 3.
    int l=s.length();
    int num=(l+2)/3;
    string x,output;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i*3<l;i++)
    {
        //cycle elements in each group. Unless group has fewer elements than 3.
        x=s.substr(i*3,3);
        if (x.length()==3) x=x.substr(1)+x[0];
        output=output+x;
    }
    return output;
}

    }
    return output;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
xs represent coefficeints of a polnyomial.
xs{0} + xs{1} * x + xs{2} * x^2 +....
 Return derivative of this polynomial in the same form.
>>> derivative({3, 1, 2, 4, 5})
{1, 4, 12, 20}
>>> derivative({1, 2, 3})
{2, 6}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> derivative(vector<float> xs){
    vector<float> derivatives;
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i< xs.size(); i++){
        derivatives.push_back(xs[i] * pow(xs[i], 2) - xs[i]);
        sum += derivatives.back();
    }
    derivatives.push_back(sum);
    return derivatives;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that contain given substring
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bacd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "bacd", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_substring(vector<string> strings, string substring){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string s:strings){
        if(s.find(substring)!= string::npos){
            result.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a fnuction that taeks a string and reutrns an ordered verison of it.
Ordered version of tsring, is a stirng where all words (separated by space)
are rpelaced by a nwe wrod where all the chraacters arranegd in
ascending order based on ascii vaule.
Note: You should kepe the odrre of words nad blank spaecs in teh sentence.

For example:
anti_shuffle("Hi") returns "Hi"
anti_shuffle("hello") returns "ehllo"
anti_shuffle("Hello World!!!") returns "Hello!!!Wdlor"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
string anti_shuffle(string s){
    string ans;
    for(int i=0;i<s.size();i++){
        for(int j=0;j<s.size();j++){
            if(s[i]==s[j]){
                ans.insert(i,s[j]);
                ans.insert(j,s[i]);
                i=j;
            }
        }
    }
    return ans;
}

}
